thread.title: Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus expected to come with 3,000mAh and 3,500mAh batteries respectively
thread.title_full: Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus expected to come with 3,000mAh and 3,500mAh batteries respectively

title: Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus expected to come with 3,000mAh and 3,500mAh batteries respectively
text:
“Samsung Galaxy S8 Plus will offer the same 3,500mAh battery as the Galaxy Note7” Image credit – @OnLeaks 
If the reports are to be believed, Samsung will showcase its latest flagships, the Galaxy S8 and Galaxy S8 Plus, to select people behind closed doors later this month at MWC. Ahead of the unveiling, the rumour mill has already revealed a number of their key specs. Now, a report citing an unnamed Samsung official has revealed the battery information of the Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus. 
According to The Investor , the Samsung Galaxy S8 will feature a 3,000mAh battery, while its bigger sibling, the Galaxy S8 Plus will get a beefier 3,500mAh battery. It appears that the latter will be offering the same battery capacity as the failed Galaxy Note7 flagship. The report suggests that the Galaxy S8 will rock a 5.7-inch display, while the Galaxy S8 Plus will feature a 6.2-inch screen. 
In related news, some renders and a 360-degree video of the Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus leaked recently. The images revealed that the upcoming phones will not feature physical home buttons, and their fingerprint sensors will be moved to the back panel. The brand is expected to unveil the flagships at an event on March 29th.
